alert.note: Alert for Washington (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 16 at 12:13AM MDT until March 16 at 6:52PM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Utah... Virgin River At Bloomington affecting Washington County. For the Virgin River...including Bloomington...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Virgin River At Bloomington. * WHEN...Until this evening. * IMPACTS...At 17.0 feet, the Virgin River is expected to flood the Bloomington Park area bordering the Virgin River near Bloomington. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:45 PM MDT Wednesday the stage was 16.4 feet. - The Virgin River at Bloomington will continue to rise tonight. - Forecast...The river will peak around moderate flood stage with a maximum value of 17.1 feet, or 10,800 cubic feet per second (CFS), this morning. - Flood stage is 16.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 17.8 feet on 01/05/2008. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 415 AM MDT.
